001package Tools;
002
003import java.awt.Rectangle;
004
005import ij.IJ;
006import ij.ImagePlus;
007import ij.WindowManager;
008import ij.gui.Roi;
009import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
010import imagingbook.lib.ij.GuiTools;
011
012
013/**
014 * Zooms the current image, such that the given selection (ROI) fits
015 * the image window.
016 * The top-left anchor corner of the new view is set to
017 * the top-left corner of the current ROI (which may be of any type).
018 * The magnification factor is determined from the width/height of the
019 * ROI's bounding rectangle, such that the selected box always fits entirely
020 * into the current image window.
021 * If the resulting view has no complete coverage by the source image,
022 * the plugin does nothing.
023 * The size of the existing image window is never changed.
024 * <br>
025 * The functionality is similar to ImageJ's
026 * "Image &rarr; Zoom &rarr; To Selection" operator which, however, only
027 * supports a limited number of predefined magnification values.
028 * 
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2020/12/17
032 */
033public class Zoom_To_Selection implements PlugIn {
034        
035        private static boolean LOG_OUTPUT = false;
036        
037        @Override
038        public void run(String arg) {
039                ImagePlus im = WindowManager.getCurrentImage();
040                if (im == null) {
041                        IJ.showMessage("No image open");
042                        return;
043                }
044                Roi roi = im.getRoi();
045                if (roi == null) {
046                        IJ.showMessage("Selection required");
047                        return;
048                }
049                
050                Rectangle bounds = roi.getBounds();
051                IJ.log("bounds = " + bounds);
052                
053                if (bounds.width == 0 || bounds.height == 0) {
054                        IJ.showMessage("Selected width and height must not be zero");
055                        return;
056                }
057                
058                double xmag = (double) im.getWidth() / bounds.width;
059                double ymag = (double) im.getHeight() / bounds.height;  
060                double mag =  Math.min(xmag, ymag);
061                
062                Rectangle srcRect = GuiTools.setImageView(im, mag, bounds.x, bounds.y);
063                
064                if (srcRect == null) {
065                        IJ.showMessage("Failed to set view");
066                }
067                else {
068                        if (LOG_OUTPUT) {
069                                IJ.log(String.format("new magnification: %.3f",  GuiTools.getMagnification(im)));
070                        }
071                }
072        }
073        
074}
